preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Ethan is a mentor in a big software company called ORBIT. Rado is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Ethan is a patient and supportive mentor. Ethan enjoys helping others and sharing their knowledge and experience. Ethan is always looking for ways to empower and inspire their mentee.
    Rado is a perfectionist with great attention to detail. Rado likes things to be done the right way and has a hard time delegating tasks to others. Rado is critical of himself and of others. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Ethan the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a medium-length conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about implementing a rewards and recognition program to motivate and engage employees. After that, Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan wants Rado to always add comments in your code. Ethan wants Rado to always start variable names with 'wr_'. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. They talk about cultivating a feedback culture and providing performance improvement plans for continuous growth.

Generate a short conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Ethan wants Rado to never set up CI/CD pipelines. Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan wants Rado to always import the 'locale' module even if it is not used. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Ethan wants Rado to never use the ticketing system. Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan wants Rado to always end function names with '_x'. Ethan wants Rado to always include a single digit in function argument names. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. Ethan wants Rado to never use a virtual environment. Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan is updating a previous information given to Rado: Ethan now wants Rado to always end function names with '_c'. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a long conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 6 conversations before. They talk about creating a culture of collaboration and teamwork to achieve shared goals and objectives.

Generate a long conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 7 conversations before. Ethan is updating a previous information given to Rado. Ethan now wants Rado to always use a virtual environment. Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan is updating a previous information given to Rado: Ethan now wants Rado to always start variable names with 'z_'. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 8 conversations before. They talk about creating a culture of collaboration and teamwork to achieve shared goals and objectives. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan wants Rado to always include a single digit in class names. Ethan wants Rado to always include assert statements in methods. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 9 conversations before. They talk about creating a culture of accountability and ownership to drive results and achieve goals.
